programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents today's show from Shepton Mallet Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair. Helped by experts Kate Bliss and Colin Young, the teams scour the stalls for the most profitable items to sell at auction. Charlie heads to Wells Cathedral to marvel at the oldest clock with a dial in the world.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive heads north from Lazio's capital, Rome, to the dramatic valleys of Italy's badlands, out of which rise the fairy-tale citadel of Civita di Bagnoregio - Lazio's ghost town. Meeting one of the 20 remaining residents, Clive finds out what it's like to be outnumbered by a million annual visitors, and he explores the ancient tunnels beneath the town to discover why it's slowly crumbling to dust

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Puppy Coal from the Dogs Trust is being treated for aspiration pneumonia, caused by food going into his lungs. He was born at the hospital on Boxing Day by caesarean section, so the team have developed a close bond with him. However, over the last six months, he has suffered repeated infections. After numerous admissions, the team decide to operate to give him the best chance of a normal life. Also in the pet hospital for an operation is Grayson, a border collie puppy who has broken his leg after falling off a bed. With the break near his growth plate, it's vital to get it right. In oncology, a new scanning technique is being used for the first time to check if Poppy the labradoodle has the all-clear from cancer.

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: 51-year-old fitness and body coach Zara takes the group on a hike across Llandudno's Great Orme. They climb the hillside to reach the summit, past the historic Great Orme tramway. From here, it's a quick descent down to the west shore, taking in the gorgeous 360 degrees of the north Wales coastline. As well as jaw-dropping views, Zara hopes her fitness-filled Great Orme walk - topped off with a spot of paddle boarding for good measure - will be a sure-fire slam dunk with the rest of the group. But could it be one challenge too far for the others?

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Join presenter Jo Coburn as she discusses the latest political news and stories in a conversational format, covering the comings-and-goings from Westminster in the BBC's daily politics programme. Featuring opinions and arguments from all the sides of the political spectrum, the show invites informed and opinionated guests to share their views on the stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Game show in which players must avoid giving impossible answers to a set of questions.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz featuring probably the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: Un menu en or
programme.desc: Des cuisiniers et des restaurateurs tentent de faire la promotion de leurs recettes devant des investisseurs. Les plus audacieux et talentueux ouvriront leur restaurant. (VO : Million Pound Menu).

programme.title: Au coeur du cosmos
programme.desc: Comment se constituent les atomes et les molécules et comment s'organise la matière pour prendre forme ? Explication de l'une des lois universelles.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The quarter-finalists make 1930s sailor trousers and fit glamorous evening gowns.

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: Paul Martin is joined by experts Mark Stacey and Philip Serrell at Stockport Town Hall.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt face more questions.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive has visited Rome with his wife Catherine and his mates, as well as for the BBC - this time, he heads out of the centre and up one of the city's seven hills to the rarely visited neighbourhood of Monteverde, where he talks football with a butcher and puts his Caribbean cooking knowledge to good use. He also comes to the surprising realisation that if he ever moves to Rome, he'll likely take up cricket.

programme.title: Les motards poilus : Cooking Trip en Méditerranée
programme.desc: David Myers et Simon King, reprennent du service ! Direction la Méditerranée, pour une aventure gourmande gorgée de soleil. Cette fois-ci, les motards poilus partiront à la découverte des saveurs authentiques de cette fameuse cuisine méditerranéenne en se rendant en Italie, en traversant les îles Baléares pour terminer leur food trip sur les côtes espagnoles.

programme.title: Banjo: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: With Banjo's design reputation growing, the Isle of Mull Rugby Club hire him to redesign their bar to reflect the club's rich history. But with a large space to fill, and little knowledge of sport, Banjo is out of his creative comfort zone. With only a few days to complete the makeover, Banjo must face up to his past to find a way to complete this tricky brief. But how will his adventurous design go down with the club's players and members?

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The judges are in the south west where they must choose between an Edwardian townhouse on the Mumbles, a converted watermill near Ammanford and a reimagined cottage in Kidwelly. Scoring them on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style, which home will Owain, Mandy and Glen choose to go forward to the grand final?

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Erdogan cracks down hard on dissent, becoming the most powerful leader of modern Turkey.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: Red Joan
programme.desc: Londres, mai 2000. Joan Elizabeth Stanley, la plus ancienne espionne britannique, est arrêtée à son domicile par les services secrets pour 27 chefs d'accusation, notamment pour trahison et espionnage. Poussée à révéler son passé, Joan se souvient de ses jeunes années durant lesquelles elle étudie la physique à l'Université de Cambridge. C'est à ce moment qu'elle rencontre et tombe amoureuse de Leo, un jeune homme russe, étroitement lié au Parti communiste. Après la guerre, elle est employée comme assistante dans un centre de recherche nucléaire tenu secret. Très vite, elle fait face à un dilemne : faut-il trahir son pays si cela permettrait de sauver des gens ? Année de réalisation : 2018

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon sends his teams up 40-foot tall trees, in a nerve-wracking challenge.

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Surgeon Kostas Papagiannopoulos must investigate a suspicious growth on a patient's lung.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the Welsh Marches, the borderlands with England, discovering amazing wildlife in this surprisingly diverse area. In the Gwent Levels, he is treated to a chorus of birdsong and hunts for one of the rarest bees in Britain - the shrill carder bee. In the Wye Valley, he sets trail cameras to capture shots of elusive wild boar and searches for the rare hawfinch and camouflaged nightjar. Iolo ends this portion of his journey at Llanthony Priory, where house martins are nesting in the ruins.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
